Author: lukechilds#2707
Content:
This is incorrect:
```
While Ledger hardware wallets have supported storing Komodo for quite some time, previously it was not possible to claim the 5% Active User Reward, as it did not set a transaction LockTime which is used to calculate the rewards.
```
nLockTime is required on transactions for the outputs to accrue interest, however this wasn't the issue on the Ledger, transactions sent to the Ledger from elsewhere with nLockTime set would still accrue interest.

The issue was that actual KMD app running on the Ledger could not sign reward claim transactions because the outputs are larger than the inputs. This breaks BTC consensus rules the Ledger device would throw an error and refuse to sign.

This needed to be fixed in the KMD Ledger app (that runs on the device, not Ledger Live) before any software could get the Ledger to sign a reward claim transaction

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: Submitted a PR to Ledger Live to make it set nLockTime in KMD transactions by default

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: This will mean you can make transactions with Ledger Live and still earn rewards on your change UTXOs

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: (currently if you have a single UTXO earning rewards and then make a transactions, your change UTXO will contain your entire balance and won't have nLockime set so won't accrue rewards anymore)

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: https://github.com/LedgerHQ/ledger-live-desktop/pull/1825

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: If you're on GitHub then giving the issue a thumbs up would help to show Ledger there are users that want this change

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: Or if you're not on GitHub you can RT this to hopefully get some others to thumbs up

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: https://twitter.com/lukechilds/status/1099266497535401988

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: There are issues with the latest version of Chrome not being able to communicate with Ledger devices over the U2F API

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: so if you are experiencing strange errors with the KMD Ledger rewards app that is most likely the cause

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: It's out of our hands, Ledger are aware of the issue and are working on a fix in a new KMD Ledger app update

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: once they've released it you should be able to just update your KMD/BTC app on your Ledger with Ledger Live and then the app should work in latest Chrome again

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: as a temporary work around, the app should still function perfectly in older versions of Chrome or up to date versions of Opera and Brave

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: PR merged into Ledger Live to support setting nLockTime on KMD transactions!

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: Update should be rolled out shortly

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: https://github.com/LedgerHQ/ledger-live-desktop/pull/1829

Author: lukechilds#2707

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: So users will not lose interest in Ledger Live?

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: @PTYX it's kind of complicated to explain

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: Short version: Now UTXOs created by transactions originating from Ledger Live will accrue rewards

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: previously they wouldn't

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: Long version:

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content:
Previously if I sent you 100 KMD fro my Agama wallet to your Ledger Live wallet, Agama will set nLockTime so the UTXOs sitting in Ledger Live will accrue rewards. You can then use our Ledger reward claim app to claim those rewards. Everything is good.

However, if I sent you that 100 KMD and you then sent 5 KMD to somebody, Ledger Live would use your 100 KMD UTXO and split it into 5 KMD to the recipient and 95 KMD back to you as change. However, it doen't set nLockTime. So now your 95 KMD balance is sitting in a change UTXO from a transaction with no nLockTime set so will no longer accrue rewards.

This PR fixes that. It makes sure all KMD transactions created by Ledger Live have nLockTime set so you can make transactions and your change UTXOs will always accrue rewards.

Author: lukechilds#2707
Content: It also means any recipients you pay from Ledger Live will also start earning rewards on their UTXOs
